title: Ticket #7472: Allow condor-master to run as pid 1 for containers
description:
Today, we can't start the condor_master inside a container as pid 1. This is because our signal-sending code assumes that sending signals to low numbers pids must be a bug, and asserts (!). Let's remove this check so that we can just run the condor_master as pid 1 inside a container. Without this, I've had to resort to hacks like running

/bin/sh -c 'sleep 0 ; condor_master -f'

to force a few fork/exec's so that the master has a high enough pid to work.
